speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: We shall find a time, Audrey. Patience,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: gentle Audrey.

speaker: AUDREY
text: Faith, the priest was good enough, for all the

speaker: AUDREY
text: old gentleman’s saying.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: A most wicked Sir Oliver, Audrey, a most

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: vile Martext. But Audrey, there is a youth here in

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: the forest lays claim to you.

speaker: AUDREY
text: Ay, I know who ’tis. He hath no interest in me

speaker: AUDREY
text: in the world.

speaker: AUDREY
text: Here comes the man you mean.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: It is meat and drink to me to see a clown.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: By my troth, we that have good wits have much to

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: answer for. We shall be flouting. We cannot hold.

speaker: WILLIAM
text: Good ev’n, Audrey.

speaker: AUDREY
text: God gi’ good ev’n, William.

speaker: WILLIAM
text: And good ev’n to you, sir.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Good ev’n, gentle friend. Cover thy head,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: cover thy head. Nay, prithee, be covered. How old

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: are you, friend?

speaker: WILLIAM
text: Five-and-twenty, sir.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: A ripe age. Is thy name William?

speaker: WILLIAM
text: William, sir.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: A fair name. Wast born i’ th’ forest here?

speaker: WILLIAM
text: Ay, sir, I thank God.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: “Thank God.” A good answer. Art rich?

speaker: WILLIAM
text: ’Faith sir, so-so.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: “So-so” is good, very good, very excellent

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: good. And yet it is not: it is but so-so. Art thou wise?

speaker: WILLIAM
text: Ay, sir, I have a pretty wit.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Why, thou sayst well. I do now remember

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: a saying: “The fool doth think he is wise, but the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: wise man knows himself to be a fool.” The heathen

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: philosopher, when he had a desire to eat a grape,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: would open his lips when he put it into his mouth,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: meaning thereby that grapes were made to eat and

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: lips to open. You do love this maid?

speaker: WILLIAM
text: I do, sir.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Give me your hand. Art thou learned?

speaker: WILLIAM
text: No, sir.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Then learn this of me: to have is to have.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: For it is a figure in rhetoric that drink, being poured

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: out of a cup into a glass, by filling the one doth

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: empty the other. For all your writers do consent

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: that ipse is “he.” Now, you are not ipse, for I am he.

speaker: WILLIAM
text: Which he, sir?

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: He, sir, that must marry this woman.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Therefore, you clown, abandon—which is in the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: vulgar “leave”—the society—which in the boorish

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: is “company”—of this female—which in the common

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: is “woman”; which together is, abandon the

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: society of this female, or, clown, thou perishest; or,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: to thy better understanding, diest; or, to wit, I kill

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: thee, make thee away, translate thy life into death,

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: thy liberty into bondage. I will deal in poison with

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: thee, or in bastinado, or in steel. I will bandy with

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: thee in faction. I will o’errun thee with policy. I

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: will kill thee a hundred and fifty ways. Therefore

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: tremble and depart.

speaker: AUDREY
text: Do, good William.

speaker: WILLIAM
text: God rest you merry, sir.

speaker: CORIN
text: Our master and mistress seeks you. Come away,

speaker: CORIN
text: away.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Trip, Audrey, trip, Audrey.—I attend, I

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: attend.
